text: In python is there an easier way to write 6 nested for loops?
This problem has been getting at me for a while now.
Is there an easier way to write nested for loops in python?
For example if my code went something like this:

code:
for y in range(3):
    for x in range(3):
      do_something()
      for y1 in range(3):
        for x1 in range(3):
          do_something_else()

text: would there be an easier way to do this?
I know that this code works but when you indent instead of using 2 spaces, like me, it can get to be a problem.
Oh in the example there were only 4 nested for loops to make things easier.
